item.title: Asia | Thailand and Cambodia signal from the ordinary border

item.title: Malparado | SME debts rise to higher value since 2008
item.description:
Macao's badly and medium -sized corporate credit has risen at the first half of the year to 7.6 percent, the highest value since 2008, when the mandate faced the impact of the international financial crisis. However, in the same period more credits were approved, with fewer guarantees required
In the first six months of this year, the balance-related balance balance unpaid by small and medium enterprises (SME) reached a level of 5.6 billion patacas, Macao monetary authority (AMCM) revealed on Friday. The authority adds that the 7.6 percent increase in the evil credit in the first half of 2025 was due, "mainly, the fall in the balance of debt loans granted to SMEs." The proportion of misconduct in the first half of 2025 registered a 1.4 percentage points, compared to the 6.2 percent of the first half of 2024, or an annual increase of 700 million bars of credit for paying. AMCM advised the bank sector to stress negotiations with the SMEs to create “flexible reimbursement plans, under the principle of prudent risk management and in accordance with their own credit policies, continuing to provide credit support to customers with liquidity difficulties”. The level of misconduct registered in the first half of this year reached the highest absolute value since 2028, when the MSAR felt the impact of the world financial crisis. Credit death Despite the historical levels of the debt ratio for paying, in the first half of 2025 there was a considerable increase in SME -approved credits, compared to the previous semester, plus 47.7 percent to a total of 4.9 billion patacas. At the same time as approved credits increased, the requirements for approval went in the opposite direction. "The warranty ratio (which indicates the proportion of credit limit with promised bodily assets) was 62.2 percent, corresponding to a decrease of 14.5 percentage points (PP) when compared to the latest data," said AMCM. Another contradictory trend revealed by AMCM data concerns the balance of SME loans, which, despite the increase in approved credits, descended in the first half of this year 4.7 percent to a total of 743.5 billion patacas, compared to the last semester of 2024. When the analysis is made according to economic use, it was found that the loans granted to the sector in “Transport, Storage and Communications” increased 14.1 percent, while to sectors in “thick trade and retail” and “construction” registered decreases of 9.9 and 2.8 percent, respectively.

item.title: Consumption | New Round of the Grand Prix in September
item.description:
Next week it starts another major consumption award, which by the end of November will draw discounts on local commerce. The budget of this edition rose almost 65 percent and brings two news: the increase in the direct discount to the elderly, which passes to 500 patacas and the social care card
The government and the Macao Commercial Association presented on Friday another edition of the Grand Prix of Consumption, which begins on September 1 (Monday next week) and ends on November 30. The new round of discounts will follow the same molds of the previous edition, but the budget will be higher, totaling 485 million patacas for consumption benefits awarded over the 13 weeks of the initiative, more 64.4 percent, or 190 million patacas, compared to the edition that took place between March and May this year. However, the new edition of the Grand Prix of Consumption will have two news. The first is the increase in the value of the “immediate discount for the elderly” to 500 patacas, compared to the 300 patacas from the previous edition, which inaugurated direct support to the elderly to the second news, is the creation of a “social care card” with 500 patacas for immediate discount benefits to the holders of the disability assessment card. Regarding the Macau Pass card for the elderly, users can use the anterior edition card, just to load 500 patacas at more than 100 service stations scattered by Macao. If you need a new card, you can request it until November 18 at the Central Zone-South (Patane), North Zone (Tamagnini Barbosa), Northwest (Green Island), Taipa and Coloane (on Harmonia Avenue and Regisher Rua), and at the General Rehabilitation Evaluation Center. The Social Care Card can be raised in institutions and centers coordinated by the Institute of Social Action. The government points out, however, that "it is not possible to enjoy the two types of benefit simultaneously." The street spoke Moreover, the new edition of the Grand Prix of Consumption will keep the same molds. During the week, mobile QR code mobile applications collaborating with the initiative have three draws to gain discount coupons when they spend more than 50 patacas on a transaction. For each mobile application, the user is entitled to three draws per week. Discount coupons will remain between 10 patacas and 200 patacas that have to be spent on purchases "equal to or greater than triple the nominal value of the coupon." That is, a 10 -headed coupon can only be spent on a purchase of at least 30 patacas. In addition, every week there is a draw for those who used the mobile applications that will assign three 8,000 patacas awards. During the presentation of the new edition of the consumption and trade support measure, the director of Economics and Technological Development Services (DSEDT), Yau Yun Wah, said that the previous edition of the Grand Prix of Consumption “obtained remarkable successes” and “produced a positive effect on the stimulus of local consumption”. The official also mentioned that the Chief Executive when he heard "opinions of society, numerous small and medium enterprises expressed the desire for the government" to continue "support for the community economy during the low season." It is also important to note that the edition of the initiative is entitled “Strength of National Games - a major award for consumption in community zones”, a name given to “respond to the enthusiastic environment of national games and taking advantage of the event effect to revitalize consumer market confidence,” the government said. Speaking to the newspaper or Mun, the vice-presidents of the Center for the Policy of Collective Wisdom subordinate to the General Union of Macao residents (Kaifong) stated that during the promotional activity there will be holidays, and that these days the government should allow the use of coupons. In addition, the deputies suggested to the Executive of Sam Hou Fai to enjoy the national games to launch a range of promotional products that sell in trade in community neighborhoods.

item.title: LAG 2026 | Mobility in public function and economy in the agenda
item.description:
Already the usual round of the collection of opinion of associative leaders for the government lines for 2026. On Friday, the meeting of the chief executive took place with six associations linked to the civil service, and was discussed the improvement of workers' mobility and economic promotion measures
Sam Hou Fai, chief executive, is already collecting opinions with associations in order to elaborate the government program for next year, better known as lines of governing action (LAG). On Friday, the meeting took place with six representative associations of civil servants, which includes the Macao Public Function Workers Association (ATFPM). According to an official note from the Chief Executive's Office, “some representatives suggested improving the internal mobility mechanism”, as well as “increasing the relevance between the formation and the functions of civil servants in order to support the modernization of the system and macao governance capacity”. Policies formulation were also requested to ensure the “protection of the rights and legitimate interests of civil service workers, the continuous improvement of training for public administration personnel, optimization of the subsidy regime and increasing the effectiveness of inter-departmental work”, among other points. Sam Hou Fai promised to “optimize personnel management and career regime”, thus creating a “internal access regime”, the promotion of “horizontal mobility and the creation of direct training plans” in the civil service. It should be noted that some leaders delivered a letter to Sam Hou Fai with concrete requests to the Public Administration area. SME and Employment in Mira Also on Friday, the maximum leader of the MSAR gathered, at the Government headquarters, with representatives of the industrial, commercial and financial sectors regarding the elaboration of LAG to 2026. In all, there were 16 associations represented at the meeting, having defended policies such as the “acceleration of urban renewal, the development of the seafarer tourism” or the incentives for the “transformation and updating of the convention and exhibition sector”. The “optimization of the business environment of small and medium enterprises (SMEs)” was also requested, as well as “safeguarding the use of the local population” or the need to “introduce high quality qualified frames in the financial sector”. In this meeting, suggestions were presented for the tourism area, in the sense of “increasing the integral competitiveness of Macau as an international tourism city”. This can go through the “concert industry development”, without forgetting “support for local cultural and creative intellectual property and improving the measures of the public transport network, attracting the flow of tourists to the development of the economy of neighborhoods”. Sam Hou Fai, in turn, admitted the existence of a “complex and changeable internal and external environment”, having argued that companies must “innovate and strengthen, injecting new dynamics into the general development of the sectors”. It was the promise of adjustment “of the development of the convention and exhibition sector”, and the adoption of “various measures to increase the flow of people in the neighborhoods and guide the market in its transformation to new consumption models”, thus supporting local SMEs.

item.title: Galaxy again hosts the second edition of the Short Film Festival
item.description: The second edition of the International Festival of Macao Entertainment Group, in a joint organization between this game operator and the Cultural Institute (IC), In addition to the screening of several films, there are also workshops, a conference on the film industry, masterclasses and awards to the best short films. According to a note from the IC, the “aims to promote Macao's film production and television production, to foster industrial diversification and reinforce the exchange and cooperation between local and international film and television sectors”. The festival includes five sections, namely “Macao Shorts”, “New Voices of the Horizon”, “Featured Director”, “East Asian Panorama” and “Special Sessions”, with views in places such as Cinemateca Passion and Galaxy theaters. The festival ends on September 20, with a ceremony at the Galaxy auditorium of the Galaxy International Convention Center. There will be awards to the directors with the best works. For the “Shorts de Macao” section, the “Macao Unit Prize” and “Special Mention of the Jury” will be delivered; For the “New Voices of the Horizon” section will be awarded the “best short film” prizes, “special jury mention”, “best director” and “innovative narrative award”. The “Asian East Prize of Tomorrow” was also created in order to distinguish prominent works from East Asia. Ten local works In the “Shorts de Macao” section, which reveals to the public “the unique cultural landscape and the innovative perspective” of local filmmakers, ten cinematic works are presented, including Chao Koi Wang's “Chuff Chuff”; Ho Cheok Pan's “Cockroach Family”; Fox Box, by Ka Meng; Teng Kun Hou; Granny Pirate 3: Typhoon Again ”by Ho Wai Tong; Jarvis Xin's “hand hand”; Chan Chon Sin's “Nuptial Flight”; Purple, by Ho Kueng Un; Keo Lou's “The Performance” and Chan Si Ieong's “Waves Under The Sea”. In "New Voices of the Horizon" are "more than 20 innovative productions of emerging directors from around the world, including the interior of China, East Asia, Southeast Asia, Europe and America." Thus, “the perspectives of the new generation of filmmakers” are presented, and provides a reflection on “the diversity and richness of film narratives around the world”. In the “Featured Director” section, short films and feature films of renowned directors will be displayed, “highlighting the significant contributions to the film arts in their respective fields”. This year, the featured director will be the Japanese Nobuhiro Yamashita, "known for his discreet style and narrative full of nuances." It is, according to the IC, a director who "captures the wit of youth and everyday life, while deepening in the psychology of the characters," performing "works that exploit Japanese society and culture with a mixture of realism and humor." In turn, in the “Panorama do East Asia” section, ten “carefully selected and characteristic” films of the Asian continent are presented.

item.title: OCX | Putin and Modi Gifts at Tianjin summit
item.description: China said Saturday that the Russian President and the Indian Prime Minister will be present at the Summit of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, rejecting any confrontation between blocks. The summit, which will take place between August 31 and September 1, in Tianjin (Northeast), "will be the largest" since the foundation of the organization, told foreign journalists in Beijing, the assistant minister of Chinese foreign affairs, Liu Bin. Liu said that “the spirit” of the organization is based on trust, mutual benefit and respect for diversity, maintaining all values ​​in the face of “outdated concepts”, such as block confrontation or the Cold War mindset. "In today's world, the old hegemony mentalities and power policies still prevail. Some countries try to put their own interests above others, which seriously threatens peace and worldly stability," he said. "The more complex and turbulent the international situation becomes, the more countries need to reinforce solidarity and cooperation to promote common development," he said. Members of the Shanghai Cooperation Organization include, in addition to the Popular Republic of China, Russia, India, Pakistan, Iran, Belarus, Kazakhstan, Kyrguistan, Tajiquistan and Uzbekistan, representing approximately 40 percent of the world population. Although member countries claim that the organization is not a military block and seeks to protect threats such as terrorism, some experts said they believed that the main objective is to be "counterpoint to the Atlantic Alliance." However, there are internal tensions within the group, which includes opposing countries such as India and Pakistan. In June, the meeting of the Ministers of Defense of Member Countries, held in the Chinese city of Qingdao, ended without a joint statement due to disagreements on security issues, particularly about terrorism. New Delhi, who refused to sign the final text, reported that some countries use terrorism as a political tool, in a veiled reference to Pakistan. Other presences In addition to Vladimir Putin and Narendra Modi, the Deputy Minister of Chinese Foreign Affairs confirmed the presence of the presidents of Belarus, Iran and Pakistan, among others. Liu said that leaders from various countries were invited, such as Mongolia, Azerbaijan, Armenia, Cambodia, Maldives, Nepal, Turkey, Iraq, Turquemenistan, Indonesia, Laos, Malaysia and Vietnam. Liu Bin also summoned the UN Secretary-General António Guterres, leaders of the Southeast Asian Nations Association (Asean), the Independent States community and the Asian Bank for Infrastructure Investment. Chinese President Xi Jinping will lead heads of state heads and the meeting with representatives of observing countries, in which issues linked to "regional security, multilateralism and sustainable development will be addressed." The meeting will take place before the Military Parade of September 3, in Beijing, in celebration of the 80th anniversary of the end of World War II in the Pacific, to which Putin will watch.

item.description: Nursed to observing European powers to enslave and colonize various spaces around the globe, Qing Dynasty China was not interested in negotiations with Western countries. In addition to wanting to maintain distance in diplomatic and relational terms, I felt no need to import any western manufacturing, that is, it did not depend on any imports. Several European countries, however, did trade with China as they were interested in Chinese products, especially in tea, porcelain and silk. These products were particularly appreciated by the British. The Chinese attitude was not well regarded by Britain that was displayed before Europe as a dominant hegemonic power. Since Britain imported large amounts of tea, silk and porcelain China, via its trade balance very unbalanced with the Chinese. This happened until they realize a highly lucrative product planted in their India colony that could be interested in the Chinese: opium. In addition to being lucrative, this product also had the power to weaken this country-continent country that appeared so interesting as a market for the European powers. With the introduction and rapid propagation of opium into Chinese society, the Beijing government decided to ban the marketing of the narcotic that was being devastating and to constitute one of the most serious public health problems in the country's history. This decision is seen by the British government as an affront to its commercial freedoms. After the introduction, marketing and spread of opium in China in 1839 Britain declares the First Opium War. Its official narrative falls on the importance of opening China's doors to international trade, for the sake of order, stability and peace. This essay aims to refute the thesis of peace by trade referring to this historical context. When objectively analyzed the international economic situation of the time, Britain's commercial interest in China was more than evident. It was a large market and, if weakened and dominated, another colony with a lot of labor to explore. That is, behind a narrative that wanted only a modern, worldwide order and which, above all, led to peace, there was a marked material interest in the Chinese market that was not harmful as it was for the British to date. Beyond material interest, the sovereign interest was also present, it was not represented in the one that would become the British colony of Hong Kong. The mandate of the sky and the singing system Beijing's isolation was an economic model parallel to the western model and did not fit the general belief in Europe of the 19th century. XIX that integration into an international order of law and trade was the only possibility of a sovereign state being recognized as civilized and, consequently, as peaceful - as it would become transparent, predictable and, according to Palmerston, modern (Palmerston, 1840). However, the Qing Empire did not share this belief. By this time the mandate of heaven [i] (天命, in Pinyin: Tianming) [II] was still the model of governance followed. According to this model, diplomacy and international trade were forms of recognition of Chinese prominence. The mandate did not necessarily imply a war relationship with neighboring peoples. Like the United States, China thought he had a special role in the universal order and they were all free from enjoying the privileges that conveyed contact with its culture. However, in an antithesis to the United States, he never expressed a desire to disseminate their values ​​around the world: it was limited to achieving foreign states to consider the tax states of China. International trade between the Chinese and foreigners formed the first sino-widening place of the modern era. Although Porto Xiamen in Fujian, it was the main gateway with Southeast Asia and the Chinese coast, after 1759 Guangzhou had become an official door for meetings with Europeans. The “Canton System” as it became known in the West was organized from typically Chinese lines: the government commissioned one of the Chinese families of merchants to act as controllers of trade with the abroad. These merchants formed an association known as Cohong, who responded to the command of a Guandong trade specialist, usually a Manchu sent from the Imperial Court in Beijing, known by foreigners as HOPPO. Cohong and Hoppo had the task of taxing foreigners and especially tea and silk exports. Until 1834, when the British Indian Company lost real support to monopolize trade with China, the company had adapted to this particular singing system. During the seasons of exchanges, the Board of Directors of the British Company of India in London lived in the British Factory (Center for Commerce and Residence), in Rio, outside the Great Capital of Guangzhou, from October to March. At the time without exchanges from April to September, they retreated to the only Chinese space concessioned to Europeans, the Portuguese city of Macau. For the Chinese, the accumulation of European interest on the Southeast coast required an efficient method to deal with “Western Sea barbarians” as they were officially designated. Nursed to observing European powers to enslave and colonize various spaces around the globe, the totalitarian attitude of Qing was not interested in major negotiations with “barbaric merchants”. This prostration ritual is an important detail in the British mission led by George Macartney in 1793 to Beijing to meet Emperor Qianglong. Its purpose was to ask the Qing Empire to respect those who were at the time the minimum international rights of which Europe enjoyed almost all the rest of the world: free trade, permanent embassies and equality of sovereignty. Until then, Europeans had no choice but to reduce the role of supplicants in the Chinese tax order-trade with barbarians was considered no more than a tribute to the Great Empire of the environment. This Chinese attitude was particularly offensive to Britain, but China's GDP was even about seven times that of Britain and hence the Emperor considered that it was London who needed help and not the other way around (Maddison, 2006). The rising western powers would not tolerate a diplomatic mechanism for much longer that referred to them as “barbarians” who paid tribute or a tight seasonal trade regulated in a single port. After the Macartney mission the Britain of the Western civilizational top had been particularly offended. A single world order - From trade to peace With the trade balance unbalanced in the face of Chinese disinterest in British manufactures, the insistence on import without opium restrictions to China was the solution found by them to finally conquer the Chinese market. Opium was introduced illicitly and with the clear purpose of addicting the Chinese population in the only product that could make profits to Britain. When opium began to circulate in the country, Beijing made an attempt to regulate and sell the product. However, the progressive destruction of populations and public health problems that quickly became visible all over the country led the court to ban their marketing. For a Britain that was beginning to ban the globalization of slavery (of which it had been paradoxically path) in order to affirm its moral superiority before the rest of Europe, the commercialization of opium caused Western a certain sense of embarrassment. But it was not only westernly that opium marketing was seen as an embarrassment. The official agent for opium eradication in China, Lin Zu, even asked Queen Vitória to be in charge of suppressing opium trade not only in China but in the Indian territories of Great Britain from where the deep degradation reports caused by the drug use were already heard all over the world (TSE-HSU, 1839). Lin makes an ultimatum to Britain that threatened to end the export of Chinese products if the British did not end the opium marketing. Certainly the great Chinese empire could not suffer from greater retaliation, the Chinese court underestimated foreign military capabilities already much more developed than the Chinese - which never had to wage great battles after the unification of the empire due to more exquisite ways to call war, such as those that can be studied in the classic art of Sun Tzu war. China had to pay Britain six million dollars of compensation, to give up Hong Kong and open five coastal ports in which Western residence and trade would be allowed (Guangzhou, Ningbo, Shanghai, Xiamen and Fuzhou). The “Canton System” had come to an end. The British also obtained the right to make direct trade that did not pass by Beijing and the power to exercise jurisdiction over their national residents in the Chinese ports of the treaty. This meant that foreign opium traders would be subject to the laws of their own countries and not China. This principle of "extraterritoriality" eventually represented the decline of imperial power. Following the concessions allowed to Britain, many other Western powers wanted to come to complain about their piece. The mandate of heaven had ended and had been replaced by the western concept of sovereignty. The Peace Thesis for Trade The thesis of peace for commerce argues that it reduces the likelihood of armed conflicts between states in a logic of interdependence in which commercial liberalism plays a central role in conducting peace, thus surpassing the conflict logic defended by realistic theorists. The Organization of International Trade (WTO) presents several arguments that underlie the fact that trade between sovereign states leads to peace, namely arguing that traders have less tendency to generate conflicts with their clients (World Trade Organization, 2003: 2); The second argument is that disputes are constructively dealt with in the procedures of institutions and organizations. Liberal peace supporters argue that interdependence reduces conflict because conflict reduces trade. Economic interdependence promotes peace because the conflict is inconsistent with economic ties that promote mutual benefit (Polachek & Xiang, 2008). The thesis was, however, over time changing the empirical basis. At first time when the essential operating concept is called “comparative advantages”. It is the time of international economic life that has been conceptualized in traditional international trade theories. Each state explores the competitive advantages it has in the international system. Where before we had political units, we now have economic units. From the 80s onwards it becomes a mesh of bilateral relations, thus globalization the loss of this national reference. The Anglo-Chinese war was presented by the British government as a necessary process in which the ends justified the means. Despite the universally recognized ethical and moral failure of the illegal dissemination of a narcotic view to the forced opening of a state to international trade legislation, the united kingdom's official apology has never been formalized, not even when the recovery of Hong Kong sovereignty by the popular republic of China in 1997. item.title: Today Macau
item.description: Thailand and Cambodia have agreed to remove the mines along the border that separates the two countries and to proceed to the “clear assignment” of territories whose sovereignty is disputed by Bangkok and Phnom Penh. The decision results from an extraordinary meeting Friday of the Regional Border Committee (RBC), integrated by both countries, said yesterday the spokesman for the office of the Prime Minister of Thailand, Jirayu Huangsap. Several incidents with terrestrial mines in the border zones were recently recorded, the latest from which it occurred on August 12, when a Thai military man was injured. Two other incidents, on July 16 and 23, preceded the armed confrontation that broke out on the 24th of this month between Thailand and Cambodia, which lasted for five days and left at least 44 killed, including civilians, at various points in the almost 820 kilometers of border. The agreement for the removal of mines and “clear attribution” of the border zones disputed is added a pact for the “joint disarticulation” of criminal networks dedicated to global cyberphraud, strongly implanted along the border of the two countries. Precisely, these very powerful cyberphraude sites were pointed out by Thailand's first-rate minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra as one of the possible triggers of the armed confrontation in which Thailand and Cambodia were involved last month. Paetongtarn stated that the conflict could be related to his government's plans to combat these centers, with a large presence in Cambodia and are determinant for his economy. On July 28, Bangkok and Phnom Penh signed in Malaysia a ceasefire for armed confrontation, although both parties were later charged with violating the agreement. The border between these neighboring countries was cartographed by France in 1907, when Cambodia was a French colony.

item.title: Rain | HK alerts and more than 80,000 residents of Beijing removed from home
item.description:
China and Hong Kong have faced periods of heavy rainfall in recent days that have forced extra care and residents' travel. In the Chinese capital 82,000 people had to leave their homes, while in Hong Kong streets and a hospital suffered floods and some subway seasons were closed
Strong rains continue not to give respite, not only in Macau (see page 7), but in Hong Kong and in the interior of the country. In the case of China, Beijing authorities moved more than 82,000 people from home due to torrential rain, a week after deadly floods that led those responsible for recognizing failures in the response, the official news agency Xinhua said yesterday. Thus, tens of thousands of residents were removed from the most affected areas by rain until 9 pm on Monday, local time, according to the Municipal Flood Response Center. The center warned of the high risk of floods in the districts of Miyun (northwest), Fangshan (southwest), lied (west) and Huairou (north). The Chinese capital kept in force the red alert-the highest-until yesterday morning, before predictions of heavy rain between Monday and the morning of Tuesday. Last week, these same rural districts north of Beijing were the most affected by the weather that caused 44 dead and nine missing, according to official data. Most of the deadly victims were registered in a home of elderly in Miyun. New measures in agriculture A gravidade da catástrofe levou as autoridades municipais a reconhecerem “lacunas” na preparação dos serviços de emergência. Desastres naturais são frequentes na China durante o Verão, com algumas regiões sujeitas a chuvas torrenciais e outras a secas severas. However, the Chinese authorities have reinforced the device to respond to the adverse effects of intense rainfall and heat waves on agricultural crops in various regions of the country, at a crucial time for autumn harvesting. Since the beginning of the rainy season, east and northern China areas have recorded episodes of extreme precipitation, while provinces such as Henan (Center) and Anhui (East) face prolonged periods of drought and high temperatures. This combination of meteorological phenomena represents a challenge for farmers, especially when about two months left to harvest the main autumn cereals, the official news agency Xinhua yesterday pointed out. In the province of Shaanxi (Center), where precipitation recently exceeded 100 millimeters in less than 24 hours, local authorities adopted preventive measures such as channel cleaning and reinforcement of dikes, which allowed to protect most of the cultivated lands. However, Henan agricultural cooperatives affected by drought opted for gout watering systems and localized application of fertilizers to conserve moisture and minimize losses. Authorities have given priority to the rehabilitation of water infrastructure and the dissemination of efficient water management techniques in the absence of precipitation in some areas. The autumn campaign represents a fundamental component of China's annual cereal production. In a statement issued yesterday, the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Affairs warned that weather conditions in the coming weeks will be determining and appealed to "all efforts to protect the harvest and give strong support to the country's food security." Chinese President Xi Jinping said in 2023 that, although “1,400 million Chinese eat well” currently, “the food issue should not be careless”, stressing that the supply of food “is not an insignificant issue”. China has less than nine percent of the planet's aurable land, although it represents about 18 percent of the world's population. In the last summers, weather disasters have caused significant damage in the country: the 2023 scirred months were marked by flooding in Beijing, which caused more than 30 dead, while by 2022 several extreme and dried heat waves hit the center and east of China. Hong Kong on Alert With regard to the panorama of heavy rains in neighboring territory, they have not given respite either. According to public broadcaster RTHK, some hong Kong stations were closed yesterday due to the risk of flooding, given that the Hong Kong Observatory kept the black signal of storm [Black Rainestorm Warning Signal] until around 17 hours. Winds of about 110 kilometers per hour were recorded in some areas of the territory, and thunderstorms were also registered. The rthk channel also reveals that more than 10,800 lightnings were counted in the territory between midnight and 10 am yesterday, half of them occurred on Lantau Island. Until 11 am yesterday, the authorities responsible for the drainage systems recorded 21 episodes of flooding, and 180 emergency responses were made in 240 different locations. Highlight for the occurrence of an episode at Queen Mary Hospital this Tuesday, namely “on some roads” hospital access in Pok Fu Lam, and patients were displaced by firefighters to Ruttonjee Hospital in the Wanchai area. In some zones of the hospital the water reached the knees, and sand bags were placed to stop the flow of the rains. At about 11 am yesterday this scenario was resolved, with the normal one returning to the Queen Mary Hospital near noon. The rains also led to the large increase in water level in the Lower Shing Mun reservoir in the Shaan area, which led to the notification of nearby housing complexes, such as Mei Lam Estate, May Shing Court, Mei Chung Court and Granville Garden. Despite the heavy rains, some people went to work normally doing alternative routes. This was the case of Mak, a woman who, to the RTHK channel, said she had to make a deviation to get to the office. “I couldn't go straight to there and had to make a longer route. The metro [mtr] made some warnings [about the storm and closures], but I would like them to do them in the carriages as well, because I only realized that access was closed when I got to the exit,” he described. The sun Information provided by the Hong Kong Observatory speaks of the passage of an active "southwest monsoon and high altitude disturbances that are bringing heavy rainfall and violent thunderstorms to the southern coast of China and the northern part of the southern China Sea." Yesterday the highest daily precipitation record was broken to August since 1884, upon registered, until 14h, 355.7 millimeters of precipitation at the Observatory's headquarters. For today time should stay unstable in Hong Kong, with “heavy rains at the beginning” of the day. However, these "should gradually decrease" tomorrow, expected "a lot of heat with sunny periods in the next two days." Also the Meteorological and Geophysical Services (SMG) leave a heavy rain alert to this day with “frequent, sometimes intense, thunderstorm”. The sun is expected to start appearing at the MSAR from tomorrow, still with some clouds, extending this weather scenario until next Monday. Temperatures should reach 33 degrees.

Operating since 1999, the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center will merge with the Foundation for Science and Technology and the National Innovation Agency, creating a new institution. The practical consequences for the CCCM that aims to promote studies on Macao, China and Asia in Portugal are unknown. The president of the center says it is early to make comments
It is not known whether it will maintain its name, the number of scholarships for studies on China, Macao and Asia, or whether to change staff, but what is certain is that the Macao Scientific and Cultural Center (CCCM) will merge with the Foundation for Science and Technology (FCT) and the National Innovation Agency. Of these three entities will be born the new agency for research and innovation. The process is linked to the desire to reform the Ministry of Education, Science and Technology by the Portuguese government led by Luís Montenegro, and the changes were announced on Thursday. However, there is still no great information about the consequences of this merger to the CCCM. At HM, Carmen Amado Mendes, its president, chose to refer to clarification for the future operation of the center, considering that it is "premature" to give answers about something "that is not yet defined." On Thursday, Minister Fernando Alexandre announced the reform of the Ministry of Education, Science and Innovation with the extinction of several entities, including FCT that has been the main financier of PhD and other research projects in Portugal. The reform of the ministry was approved by the Council of Ministers and, at a press conference at the end of the meeting, Fernando Alexandre justified the restructuring by describing his ministry as an “anacronic structure”, with fragmented organizations, disintegrated information systems and disarticulated governance. With 18 entities and 27 higher leaders between the services of the non -higher education system and higher education, science and innovation, the ministry will have only seven entities and 27 higher leaders, with the integration of extinguished entities into new entities. Regarding the extinction of the FCT, the minister assured that the financing of science will be preserved, with funding for four years that guarantees stability, predictability and “the protection of the financing of the most basic fundamental investigation”. “When we started thinking about this reform, we do it with a vision: to ensure equal opportunities to access quality education,” said Fernando Alexandre, also underlining the reinforcement of the education system. Marcelo can veto The extinction of FCT has generated some less good reactions in Portugal because it fears a reduction in investment in science and research. Marcelo Rebelo de Sousa, president of the Portuguese Republic, said he had “the sensation” that the foundation was replaced “with an agency in which he was integrated, and had other functions beyond those of FCT.” Marcelo acknowledged that the Foundation was a “very old structure” and that “it had many aspects that deserved to be rethought”, but said: “Just seeing what the new agency will do can I answer if this extinction is a good or bad idea.” As for the eventual 'green light' from Belém, Marcelo said that if he thinks this extinction is "good", promulgates the diploma "without anguish." "If you have doubts about a point that is this diploma that is very important I ask the government to rethink. It has happened. I may not veto soon. If the government insists, I can come to veto, if it is until the end of my mandate," he also admitted. A history of the transition The CCCM was born in 1995 during the administration of Vasco Rocha Vieira, the last Portuguese governor of Macao, intending to be “a place of excellence for the dissemination of Macau, its history, its culture and its economy”, reads in the memories of Rocha Vieira, “to all the ports I arrived”. This entity, operating in the Alcântara area, in Lisbon, was inaugurated in November 1999 by the then President of the Republic, Jorge Sampaio, and had as first president Alexandra Costa Gomes. On the CCCM website it is read that the institution is endowed with administrative autonomy and its own heritage, being a public institute integrated in the indirect administration of the state and under the tutelage of the Ministry of Education, Science and Innovation. In the objective booklet, it is read that the CCCM “has as its mission to produce, promote and disseminate knowledge about Macao as a platform between Portugal and the Popular Republic of China, as well as between Europe and Asia”, also presenting itself as “a space dedicated to the study and teaching of Chinese language, culture and history”. The center has also been established as "a center for scientific research and continuous and advanced training on the relations between Portugal and China, as well as between Europe and Asia." After the long presidency of Luís Filipe Barreto, academic at the University of Lisbon, the CCCM began to be chaired, from February 2020, by Carmen Amado Mendes. The leader recently saw her service committee renewed by 2030. A few months after taking office as president, Carmen Amado Mendes presented, on September 18, 2020, the new “Strategic Development Plan of the Macau Scientific and Cultural Center 2020-2030”. Since then, the CCCM has awarded dozens of doctoral scholarships for the studies of Macao, China and Asia, and the “Spring Conferences”, which bring together academic performances around the same themes every year. Also noteworthy that the CCCM opened, in December last year, the “Gallery of Governors”, with 41 paintings of the former Portuguese governors of Macao. A new building that houses the file and library was also inaugurated. This plan sets objectives by 2030, "the reinforcement of scientific and cultural cooperation in the domain of past understanding, present and future trends of relations between Europe and Asia." With regard to archives, it is intended to “modernize and dynamization within a network of documentation centers and international reference file on euro-seatic themes, with emphasis on the various files in Lisbon, but also in Portugal and Europe”. Given that the CCCM houses, in its facilities, the Macao Museum, the board points to the “insertion and appreciation in the museum network at the level of Lisbon and National”. The central idea of ​​the plan was to develop, by 2030, “CCCM facilities as a pole of streamlining scientific, cultural and economic relations between Portugal and China, including the installation of entities such as the Luso-Chinese Chamber of Commerce and Industry, the Erasmus+Youth Entrepreneurs Association, as well as research nuclei in eurical studies”. It remains to be seen if, with the merger, all these initiatives will continue their initial course.

item.title: USJ | Researchers discover a new species of bacteria in Portugal
item.description:
A team of local university researchers identified a new species of bacteria in the Salinas of Rio Maior, Portugal. The type of discovered organism, which lives in extreme environments, widens the limits of biological knowledge and may have implications in areas such as biomedicine, pharmacy or even spatial exploration
There is news in the field of microbiology thanks to the latest discovery of a team of researchers linked to the University of São José (USJ), led by André Antunes, interim director of the Institute of Sciences and Environment of the same educational institution. It is the discovery of a new species of bacteria from 12 samples collected in the Salinas of Rio Maior, in Portugal, which led to the establishment of the new species “Fodinibius alkaliphilus”. The species of bacteria previously known as “Alifodinibius salipaludis” for “Fodinibius salipaludis” was also reclassified. The conclusions appear in the article “Fodinibius alkaliphilus sp. Nov., Moderately halophilic and alkaliphilic bacterium isolated from an Inland Saltern in central and reclassification of aliifodinibius salipaludi as fodinibius salipalis sp. SYSTEMATIC AND EVOLUTIONARY MICROBIOLOGY. The scientific journal is a publication “reference for new macrobial data”, being the official publication of the International Procaryotes Systematic Committee and the Applied Bacteriology and Microbiology Division of the International Union of Microbiological Societies, describes a USJ note. In addition to André Antunes, the authors team includes researchers from the University of Science and Technology of Macau, coordinated by Marta Filipa Simões; Researchers at the University of Minho and Seville University. According to the same USJ note, "the new [bacteria] species grows better in salinities about four times higher than those of seawater and also prefers alkaline conditions, combining the ability to grow in different extreme environmental conditions." The importance of this type of studies, including analyzes to “such extreme environments”, is “future applications in a wide range of fields, including biomedical and pharmaceutical, but also extends to the discovery of new useful materials and the provision of useful information for future space exploration”. The same team of investigators is not stopped, as "other samples of these places are currently being investigated and new publications describing other new species are expected in the coming months." “This publication highlights the strengths of Macao in articulation with partners from Portuguese and Spanish -speaking countries, as well as its growing importance in the fields of biodiversity and biotechnology,” is still described. The Power of Salinas The researchers explain that "the species Aliifodinibius Salipaludis has been described, but their name has not yet been validly published." In field work the team isolated these species from “hypersaline environments, including saline, salt mines and saline soils”. Prior to the fieldwork itself, the team conducted “an investigation to the microbial diversity of hypersaline environments in downtown Portugal”, and samples were collected in the Rio Maior area in July 2019. There were 12 genera bacteria from the Rio Maior salines. Located in the central area of ​​Portugal, in these Salinas there is the “brine, which is about seven times more salty than seawater”, being “pumping from a well and generated by the crossing of a local underground course with an extensive salt deposit”. The article also gives a historical context of this location. "Although they were first referred to in twelfth-century documents, these places are believed to have been linked to salt extraction from prehistoric times. They offer a single scenario, as they are the only interior saline in Portugal and the only ones in full functioning throughout Europe." Thus, the study in question “was part of a bioprospecting campaign centered on this place”, resulting in “the isolation of a bacterial strain (N2T) and the discovery of a new putative species within the genus Fodinibius”. In this work is determined “the taxonomic position of this new isolated based on the phenotypic, chemotaxonos and molecular properties”, is described. Importance for Science At HM, André Antunes explained that this discovery is, first of all, interesting to the scientific community, by bringing “additional information” and constituting a discovery “about the biodiversity that exists on our planet, more concretely at the macrobial level”. "So far, we have been able [general scientific community] to study less than 1 percent of all microbes species on the planet. In over 99 percent we have no idea what they are, what they do and what their abilities, or what impact on the environment and our lives," he explained. The researcher also said that "the microbes that come from extreme environments, and above all from environments with a lot of salt, which is the case of this species we now discover, are very interesting for a large range of biotechnology applications." "We can include things like the medical area, biomedicine, the production of new pharmaceutical compounds or the production of new biomaterials, such as bioplastics," said André Antunes. The academic even talks about applications in “more exotic areas, which are now beginning to have a little more visibility, such as the potential application in construction, the production of more sustainable cements or concrete structures that have the self -repair capacity”. This discovery also has some impact "for space exploration, more specifically to better understand what the limits of life are and where to seek life outside our planet." It is also included "very important implications for missions that are exploring Mars, namely as to the type of environments where it may be feasible to find past signs of life or present or other parts of the solar system." A job that continues The investigation is not for the Salinas of Rio Maior, and the team led by André Antunes last year, an expedition to Antarctica. “There are antarctic samples that we are currently studying and we have samples taken from the red sea bottom, where salt concentration is also quite high.” Therefore, the saga of discovering new bacteria and potential reclassifications in those that already exist. André Antunes says that the discovery of a new species of microbes "is quite important to science, not only for the perspective of science at the basic level, but because we can have a better perspective of diversity we have on the planet." “As we study extreme environments we can have additional information about what the limits of life are and how life adapts to extreme conditions.” Thus, André Antunes advocates investment in science so that there is later “an associated practical component, so it is not always easy to convince the financing entities”, as to this point. The researcher also points out that the article and the investigation fits “very well in the priorities of Macau and the USJ itself, with regard to the focus in the area of ​​environment, biodiversity and biotechnology, anchored in connection with Lusophony”.

item.title: Australia | Great Coral Barrier has been declining since there is a record
item.description: The Great Barrier of Choir, with 2,300 kilometers long, off the Australian East, has been suffering the largest coral decline since registrations began in 1986, a yesterday report published. The Australian Institute of Marine Sciences, of the government, documented the condition of 124 reefs between August 2024 and May 2025 to determine the widespread coral lanchament in the three sections of the Greater Barrier. The impact is higher in the northern areas (Cape York to Cooktown), with a 24.8 percent decline compared to the 2024, and southern levels (proserpine to gladstone), with 30.6 percent, representing these two values ​​“the largest annual decline in coral cover” in 39 years. In the central region (cooktown to proserpine), the decline recorded is 13.9 percent compared to last year. The last episode of bleaching on site, declared UNESCO's world heritage, has a “high to extreme” prevalence in all three areas, scientists find in the report. “Individual reefs registered a decline of corals of up to 70.8 percent” near Lizard Island in the North Zone, it refers to the study. The death of the corals, manifested by its bleaching, is caused by the impact of water heating - temperatures were recorded one to 2.5 degrees Celsius above average during the southern summer of 2025 - associated with the climate crisis. The large coral barrier “experienced unprecedented levels of thermal stress, resulting in the most extensive and severe bleaching that there is registration to date”, read in the document, in reference to the phenomenon that occurred in 2024 and continued during the first months of this year. The Australian agency warns that the habitat can reach “a point of non -return”, where the choir cannot recover sufficiently quickly between catastrophic events.

item.title: Hong Kong | Economic Report Highlights Startup “Historical Record”
item.description:
"Hong Kong's startups are on the rise." This is how the executive in the neighboring region describes the business environment in the region, where they were created in 2024 about 4,700 startups, plus 10 percent of 2023. In the "Report of Hong Kong's Business Environment 2025" it is read that the territory is far from losing economic competitiveness
The Hong Kong government released last July 30 the latest report on the neighboring region's economic scene. And one of the highlights is given to the scenario of growth of entrepreneurship. In the “Report of Hong Kong’s Business Environment 2025” [Hong Kong 2025 Business Environment Report] it is noteworthy that “Startups in Hong Kong are on the rise”, given that last year there were “about 4,700 startups in the city, a historic record and an increase of 10 percent from the previous year”. The document explains that "more than a quarter of these startups has founders from outside Hong Kong," it is companies that operate in a "broad spectrum of sectors, including Fintech [High Technology], Electronic Trade and Information, Informatics and Technology", having hired more than 17,000 people. This number of human resources also represents an increase of seven percent compared to 2023. "All this is proof of Hong Kong's strong appeal for startup entrepreneurs," the authorities highlight. But it's not just startups that record growth, with the report to point out that the current government, led by executive head John Lee, "achieved remarkable results in the attraction of companies, investments and talents." "For example, in 2024, the number of companies in Hong Kong with headquarters outside the territory increased significantly by about 10 percent, reaching almost 10,000." The “Office for the attraction of strategic companies, created more than two years ago, attracted 84 strategic companies to establish or expand their business in Hong Kong, including companies with market capitalization or valuation of over $ 10 billion, involving cutting -edge technology”, it is added. The report also points out that between January 2023 and the first half of this year, Invest Hong Kong, linked to the Raehk government's direct foreign investment department, "helped over 1300 foreign and continent companies establishing or expanding their business in Hong Kong, bringing investments of over $ 160 billion." Still with regard to Invest Hong Kong, the entity helped "539 companies from the continent or foreign to establish or expand their business in Hong Kong, which represents an annual growth of over 40 percent." At the end of June this year, Hong Kong had 1.5 million local companies, while the total number of companies not registered in Hong Kong reached 15 509. "Both numbers represent historical records," it reads, and for the government of the neighboring territory the data "demonstrate the great confidence that continent and abroad companies have in the future of Hong Kong." Given that Hong Kong also has a talent capture program, the Hong Kong Talent Engage, reads in the report that by June this year "were received about 500,000 candidates in the shelter of various talent admission programs, of which about 330,000 were approved." Of these numbers, Hong Kong actually arrived to work 220,000 qualified frames. Good scholarship scenario Quoted on an official press release, a government spokesman stated that "in a complex and volatile external environment, Hong Kong is undergoing a phase of economic update and transformation, but there are more opportunities than challenges." Given that the territory has always positioned itself as a strong financial market worldwide, this scenario seems to have recorded a recovery in recent years. “This year Hong Kong's financial market performance has been constantly improving. The Hang SENG Index has a 18 percent increase last year and an increase of more than 25 percent this year so far. The average daily business volume in the first half of the year was about $ 240 billion, with an increase of about 120 percent.” Authorities highlight the maintenance of the economic competitiveness of the territory, pointing out that "over the years Hong Kong has been constantly classified as a global leader in economic freedom and competitiveness." Attention to the trade war In conclusion, Raehk's government clarifies that territory seems to maintain economic stability in times of constant commercial conflicts, with Donald Trump threatening and imposing tariffs on a number of countries. “As volatile and turbulent as the world may be, we remain firmly committed to the rules -based multilateral commercial system, with the WTO [World Trade Organization] as a nucleus, while actively participating and supporting regional economic cooperation.” The “numerous advantages of Hong Kong” are referred to, with its “highly internationalized business environment, a flexible and solid financial system, a simple and secure tax regime with low tax rates and a robust and independent legal system”. However, in the document it is also stressed that the “tariff war caused a global reallocation of capital”, and Hong Kong wants to bet on the attraction of “foreign companies and capital” to the region. The report also tells that "international organizations and foreign trade chambers in Hong Kong are confident in the future perspectives" of the territory, and that for the authorities "there is no reason to worry about some excessively pessimistic feelings." "In fact, the Raehk government is creating a new momentum and expanding the ability to support Hong Kong's economic growth, thus increasing its overall competitiveness and achieving high quality development," is still added. The executive spokesman also established a parallelism between good economic situation and political stability. "In recent years, the implementation of the National Security Law has restored a stable social environment in Hong Kong. This not only protected the rights and freedoms of the general public, but also made Hong Kong a safe haven to attract international capital and investment," he concluded. The report was presented by the secretary for Hong Kong finances, Paul Chan.

item.title: Consumption | New Round of the Grand Prix in September
item.description:
Next week it starts another major consumption award, which by the end of November will draw discounts on local commerce. The budget of this edition rose almost 65 percent and brings two news: the increase in the direct discount to the elderly, which passes to 500 patacas and the social care card
The government and the Macao Commercial Association presented on Friday another edition of the Grand Prix of Consumption, which begins on September 1 (Monday next week) and ends on November 30. The new round of discounts will follow the same molds of the previous edition, but the budget will be higher, totaling 485 million patacas for consumption benefits awarded over the 13 weeks of the initiative, more 64.4 percent, or 190 million patacas, compared to the edition that took place between March and May this year. However, the new edition of the Grand Prix of Consumption will have two news. The first is the increase in the value of the “immediate discount for the elderly” to 500 patacas, compared to the 300 patacas from the previous edition, which inaugurated direct support to the elderly to the second news, is the creation of a “social care card” with 500 patacas for immediate discount benefits to the holders of the disability assessment card. Regarding the Macau Pass card for the elderly, users can use the anterior edition card, just to load 500 patacas at more than 100 service stations scattered by Macao. If you need a new card, you can request it until November 18 at the Central Zone-South (Patane), North Zone (Tamagnini Barbosa), Northwest (Green Island), Taipa and Coloane (on Harmonia Avenue and Regisher Rua), and at the General Rehabilitation Evaluation Center. The Social Care Card can be raised in institutions and centers coordinated by the Institute of Social Action. The government points out, however, that "it is not possible to enjoy the two types of benefit simultaneously." The street spoke Moreover, the new edition of the Grand Prix of Consumption will keep the same molds. During the week, mobile QR code mobile applications collaborating with the initiative have three draws to gain discount coupons when they spend more than 50 patacas on a transaction. For each mobile application, the user is entitled to three draws per week. Discount coupons will remain between 10 patacas and 200 patacas that have to be spent on purchases "equal to or greater than triple the nominal value of the coupon." That is, a 10 -headed coupon can only be spent on a purchase of at least 30 patacas. In addition, every week there is a draw for those who used the mobile applications that will assign three 8,000 patacas awards. During the presentation of the new edition of the consumption and trade support measure, the director of Economics and Technological Development Services (DSEDT), Yau Yun Wah, said that the previous edition of the Grand Prix of Consumption “obtained remarkable successes” and “produced a positive effect on the stimulus of local consumption”. The official also mentioned that the Chief Executive when he heard "opinions of society, numerous small and medium enterprises expressed the desire for the government" to continue "support for the community economy during the low season." It is also important to note that the edition of the initiative is entitled “Strength of National Games - a major award for consumption in community zones”, a name given to “respond to the enthusiastic environment of national games and taking advantage of the event effect to revitalize consumer market confidence,” the government said. Kaifong | Order Use of Cups during the Week Deputies Leong Hong leaves and Ngan Iek Hang want the government to extend the period to spend the discount coupons of the great consumption prize on the days of the week. Speaking to the newspaper or Mun, the vice-presidents of the Center for the Policy of Collective Wisdom subordinate to the General Union of Macao residents (Kaifong) stated that during the promotional activity there will be holidays, and that these days the government should allow the use of coupons. In addition, the deputies suggested to the Executive of Sam Hou Fai to enjoy the national games to launch a range of promotional products that sell in trade in community neighborhoods.

item.title: LAG 2026 | Mobility in public function and economy in the agenda
item.description:
Already the usual round of the collection of opinion of associative leaders for the government lines for 2026. On Friday, the meeting of the Chief Executive took place with six associations linked to the civil service, having discussed the improvement of workers' mobility and economic promotion measures
Sam Hou Fai, chief executive, is already collecting opinions with associations in order to elaborate the government program for next year, better known as lines of governing action (LAG). On Friday, the meeting took place with six representative associations of civil servants, which includes the Macao Public Function Workers Association (ATFPM). According to an official note from the Chief Executive's Office, “some representatives suggested improving the internal mobility mechanism”, as well as “increasing the relevance between the formation and the functions of civil servants in order to support the modernization of the system and macao governance capacity”. Policies formulation were also requested to ensure the “protection of the rights and legitimate interests of civil service workers, the continuous improvement of training for public administration personnel, optimization of the subsidy regime and increasing the effectiveness of inter-departmental work”, among other points. Sam Hou Fai promised to “optimize personnel management and career regime”, thus creating a “internal access regime”, the promotion of “horizontal mobility and the creation of direct training plans” in the civil service. It should be noted that some leaders delivered a letter to Sam Hou Fai with concrete requests to the Public Administration area. SME and Employment in Mira Also on Friday, the maximum leader of the MSAR gathered, at the Government headquarters, with representatives of the industrial, commercial and financial sectors regarding the elaboration of LAG to 2026. In all, there were 16 associations represented at the meeting, having defended policies such as the “acceleration of urban renewal, the development of the seafarer tourism” or the incentives for the “transformation and updating of the convention and exhibition sector”. The “optimization of the business environment of small and medium enterprises (SMEs)” was also requested, as well as “safeguarding the use of the local population” or the need to “introduce high quality qualified frames in the financial sector”. In this meeting, suggestions were presented for the tourism area, in the sense of “increasing the integral competitiveness of Macau as an international tourism city”. This can go through the “concert industry development”, without forgetting “support for local cultural and creative intellectual property and improving the measures of the public transport network, attracting the flow of tourists to the development of the economy of neighborhoods”. Sam Hou Fai, in turn, admitted the existence of a “complex and changeable internal and external environment”, having argued that companies must “innovate and strengthen, injecting new dynamics into the general development of the sectors”. It was the promise of adjustment “of the development of the convention and exhibition sector”, and the adoption of “various measures to increase the flow of people in the neighborhoods and guide the market in its transformation to new consumption models”, thus supporting local SMEs.

item.title: Beijing | Inaugurated base of patriotic education for the RAES
item.description: The “Patriotism Base for Hong Kong and Macau in Beijing” is already inaugurated, and this patriotic education entity facing the special administrative regions organized together with the interior authorities of China. item.title: Maternity | Women ask for subsidy to become permanent
item.description:
The General Association of Women applauds the extent of the maternity leave support subsidy, but asks to be permanent and extended to companies with more than 100 workers. In addition, the association wants faster legislative process to increase maternity and paternity licenses
Macao's General Association of Women's Women, the Executive Council's announcement that the complementary subsidy plan attributed to employers for the remuneration paid in the maternity leave will be extended for another year. The allowance in question began to be distributed after the legal review that extended the maternity leave from 56 to 70 days, which entered into force on May 26, 2020, and would have as a maximum limit 14 days of base renumbering. The allowance was presented as a measure to apply for a transient period, allowing employers to gradually adapt to economic expenses caused by increasing the number of maternity leave days. The transition period ended in May 2023, but since then it has been consecutively renewed annually. In a statement issued on Wednesday night, the association represented by Deputy Wong Kit Cheng and Deputy Director Loi I Weng asked the complementary allowance to be permanent. Loi I Weng argued that the continuity of the temporary character of the measure does not transmit security to potential new mothers or small and medium enterprises. The leader also points out that the complementary allowance should have a wide scope and not just stay by companies with less than 100 employees and that if in the future the maternity leave increases, the government needs to readjust the allowance to alleviate companies. Quickly and well Regarding the increase in maternity leave, the Directorate of Services for Labor Affairs (DSAL) charged a third entity of studying the subject, and a public consultation and the beginning of the legislative process next year. Wong Kit Cheng is concerned about this calendar, taking into account the severity of low birth and the urgent need to solve it. As such, the deputy defends the acceleration of the process, the extension of paternity leave and that it is also complemented with a subsidy, allowing both parents to benefit from the measure. It is recalled that the paternity license remains fixed in just five days.

item.title: Chinese Orchestra | New season opens with “brightness of the east”
item.description:
The Chinese orchestra of Macau is about to begin a new show of shows and it is in this context that the show “Brightness of the East” takes place this Saturday, the 30th, marking the start of a new season of various sounds and international music. Highlight for the debut of the symphonic suite of traditional Chinese music that has the same name as the concert
The first show that gives the motto to a new season starred by the Chinese orchestra of Macau (OCM) and other guests for 2025/2026 is already known. It is “brightness of the East”, name of the symphonic suite of traditional Chinese music that will make its debut in this show that takes place Saturday, the 30th, in the large auditorium of the Cultural Center of Macau (CCM), from 20h. This “symphonic suite” was composed of a whole by composers from China, Japan and South Korea, in a creation that, according to the Cultural Institute (IC), celebrates “Cultural Integration and Artistic Synergy of the three countries within the Cidade de Cultura East Asia 2025 ′”. The show features Zhang Lie as a music director and the main conductor, followed, in addition to “brightness of the East”, a “selection of commissioned works and classic pieces of regional inspiration”. It was up to OCM to invite “the renowned Chinese composer Zhao Lin, the young composer Luo Maishuo, the Japanese Master Kaoru Wada and the Korean composer of traditional Park Bum-Hoon music to collaborate in the creation of the Chinese Traditional Music Symphony Suite” that gives the show's name. The public will be able to see an interpretation by 12 musicians from the three countries, “who will play traditional musical instruments such as Chinese Pipa and Zhongruan, Shakuhachi and Japanese Shamisen, and Haegeum and Gayageum Koreans, revealing vividly the ethnic characteristics and musical essence of the three cultures, promising a unique and engaging action,” describes the IC. One more order In addition to the aforementioned sounds, the public can also have an OCM interpretation of the composition “Night of Macau”, a work commissioned to Singapore Cultural Medal, Eric Watson, as well as other prominent regional pieces, with a view to sharing with the public Macau's vibrant cultural identity through music. Tickets are already on sale for this show, varying prices between 120 and 380 patacas. OBMEP has several musicians who dominate the art of some traditional Chinese musical instruments, such as ERHU, GAOHU or ZHONGHU. The music director and main conductor, Zhang Lie, plays the same roles in the Chinese nanjing orchestra and the Chinese orchestra of Henan. It is a renowned Chinese conductor, vice president of the Professional Committee of Regency of China and national conductor, having been recognized as a “prominent artist” by the Ministry of Culture of China. Previously, he was a permanent conductor of the Radio Symphonic Orchestra and the China and the Radio National Orchestra, as well as the Zhejiang National Orchestra, Chinese Orchestra of Guangdong and National Orchestra of Shaanxi Radio and Television.

item.title: Mam | Lok Cheong works on display at Tibet
item.description:
It's called “Tibet's Heart Ties” and is a show presented in Tibet with a total of 100 works by Lok Cheong, provided by the Macao Art Museum. It is an “exhibition that continues the artistic link between Tibet and Macao”
The Tibet Art Museum welcomes, until October 12, an exhibition with a hundred works by artist Lok Cheong provided by the Macao Art Museum (MAM). It is an event that takes place in partnership with several official entities, such as the Central Government's connection office at MSAR, the Cultural Institute (IC) or the Federation of Literary and Artistic Circles of the Tibet Autonomous Region, among others. The show in question is entitled “Ties with the Heart of Tibet: Commemoration of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of the autonomous region of Tibete-Exhibition of Lok Cheong works in Tibet” and opened to the public on the last 13th of this month, being proof of the existence “of the 30 years of artistic friendship between the two regions”. According to an IC note, the exhibition features about 100 masterpieces created over half a century by Lok Cheong, born in 1923 and died in 2006, complemented by more than 70 sketches, archival materials, photographs and other “invaluable” historical materials. According to the IC, most of these items belong to the MAM collection, and the rest are part of the artist's family spoils and the Tibet Art Museum. Portraits in 1994 The exhibition is organized in three themes, such as “Love to the Fatherland”, “capturing the character of Macao” and “portraits”, offering to the public “a systematic view of Lok Cheong's artistic development”. You can see work within the “Tibetan theme”, as is the case with “the mysterious Potala Palace” and “a hidden path, shigatse”, described by the IC as having “vibrant color explosions, in a tribute to the sacred landscapes of Tibet”. In turn, the "witnesses of history (trees with branches intertwined in the Kun Iam Tong Temple)" and "Octagonal Pavilion Library" capture "the essence of the Macao scenario over the last fifty years in dynamic brushstrokes." In addition, works such as “technicians starting to serve the homeland” and “rice offering by the homeland” demonstrate “the artist's tribute meaning to the patriotism of his compatriots”. In this exhibition and for the first time, the manuscripts of Lok Cheong's trip to Tibeto in 1994, are accompanied by rare documents that report their cultural exploitation of the heart of the homeland and the Tibet. Lok Cheong's paintings with Tibet themes became "an eternal testimony of friendship between the two regions." In 1991, the artist participated in the “Painting Exhibition of Planalto Nevado”, held in Guangzhou, starting the artistic exchange between Macau and Tibet. Subsequently, Lok Cheong continued, with his brush, to build a friendship bridge between Tibet and Macau, having organized several visits by artists from Macau to Tibet and promoted to create the first primary school under the Hope Project in Nagqu. “His pioneering spirit continues to lead cultural integration between the two regions,” he describes. Given that this year are the 60th anniversary of the establishment of the Tibet Autonomous Region, this show is held with works that carry “deep ethnic feelings in Tibet” and that honor “Lok Cheong pioneering efforts in promoting cultural exchange between Macao and Tibet”.

item.title: Isaf | Intercepted “truck” that sold illegal medicines
item.description: Last Monday, a joint action from the Institute for Pharmaceutical Supervision and Administration (Isaf) and customs services (SA) intercepted a truck used to store and sell illegally imported medicines. The “mobile drug distribution point”, as designated by the authorities, was found in the northern zone of the peninsula. Authorities found inside the vehicle "over 3000 boxes of painkillers, drugs for erectile dysfunction and traditional Chinese drugs for oral and external use." According to a statement issued Wednesday by Isaf, among the products found there were some who were not even registered or approved for import by the Isaf. The head of the commercial agency owner of the truck is suspected of having imported and provided illegally medicines. The case led Isaf to open an investigation process and the SAs accused the “the offender regarding the violation of the provisions of product imports by the commercial agency”. Anyone who imports to Macau drugs without permission or license issued by Isaf can be punished with a “maximum fine of 700,000 patacas and, for serious circumstances, incur criminal liability”.
